snippet: Despite the Sabres’ struggles, Buffalo’s love of hockey is Canadianesque: The game is in the city’s blood.
abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column; hockey fans of Buffalo prove that enthusiasm is local, national, and year long; Buffalo was the highest-rated market in the regular season for NBC and NBCSN’s national hockey games and, with Buffalo Sabres games, generated the second-highest local cable rating in the NHL; in Rounds 2 and 3 and Game 1 of the Stanley Cup finals, Buffalo had a 3.1 local rating, which ranked six, even though the Sabres were nowhere near making the playoffs.
lead_paragraph: Despite the Sabres’ struggles, Buffalo’s love of hockey is Canadianesque: The game is in the city’s blood.

headline.main: For Buffalo, Few Points on the Ice but Plenty in the TV Ratings
headline.print_headline: Few Points on Ice, but Plenty in Ratings
